item.title: Grandma, Alzheimer’s and me
item.author: George Wigmore,
item.description: It’s a strange feeling when you first step into an Alzheimer’s care home. What hits you immediately is the smell of urine and cheap school dinners, but the far more unnerving aspect is the sea of blank faces that greets you. I’m here to see my grandma, who has been suffering from Alzheimer’s for a …
